phrases: Ladies and gentlemen, good evening.
At Luna's Carnival, I encountered an immature soul.
My friend said to me, This shall be the prelude to my vengeance.
But this soul was too young and beautiful.
It is that alone which gives me because for fear.
Act 2: Until the Sun Rises Over the Moon
Are you going to come?
That is enough fun and games, boy.
I heard you met him the other day.
Are you bored?
Not at all.
It is a wonderful party, do not you think?
Where is your friend?
Oh, you mean Albert?
He is probably out trying to pick up girls, and getting turned down by every one of them.
But this is terrible!
This is Luna!
Strolling around alone at night is tantamount to suicide!
Surely you are exaggerating...
It is no laughing matter.
You will get kidnapped by Luigi Vampa!
Luigi Vampa?
He is an up-and-coming bandit!
They say that he drags his victims into the catacombs,
How horrible!
Surely the police will not stand by and do nothing.
You do not know?
The police on Luna arrange their patrols to avoid the bandits.
My very own cousin was robbed blind, had his arms and legs broken,
All because he spoke to the bandit's mistress!
I am sure he is fine.
I bet that he is back at your hotel at this very moment.
Would you care to dance?
I simply despise when a party ends.
First one guest leaves, then two.
Especially at this hour.
You will not abandon me, will you?
Take him away.
You cannot!
It is mean!
Today is my birthday!
I am sorry, Franz.
I have to go.
No, no, no!
Your father is leaving to see to some very important business.
Fine, see if I care!
I hope you never come back!
Father...
Oh, I am sorry.
Did I keep you waiting long?
Are you Baron Franz d'Epinay?
Hey, you are that...
I am sick of your whining!
As for me, I killed ten people!
This is for you.
My Lord Baron Franz d'Epinay.
I, Luigi Vampa, have taken custody of your friend, the Viscount Albert Morcerf.
Hand over the sum of 50 million ducats to my messenger immediately.
If the messenger should not return by sunrise,
Where is Albert?!
He is a valuable hostage, so we are taking real good care of him.
If the money is handed over, he will be sent home without so much as a scratch.
You should have died!
Is this how you people do things?
Even I have a certain lifestyle to maintain.
50 million is absurd!
I am sure that a Parisian aristocrat will not be hard pressed to come up with such a sum.
Dawn comes fast on Luna.
If you value your friend's life,
I want to make an immediate withdrawal from the Bank of Paris!
I am terribly sorry, sir,
Is not there anything you can do?!
How much does sir require?
Albert... Damn!
Say, son, it is awfully sad to see a young fella like yourself all alone on the last night of Carnival.
If you want, I know a fine girl who...
Please, just be quiet and drive.
It was at my father's funeral that I first met Albert...
Do not cry.
I am not crying...
I will play with you, so cheer up.
Leave me alone!
Get lost!
Hey...
Ever since that day, Albert and I have been inseparable.
Damn!
What am I going to do?
It is almost sunrise!
Have you raised the money yet?
Give me more time!
Once it is morning, I will have the money transferred from Paris!
I am sorry, Luigi is a stickler for punctuality.
If you do not have the money ready by sunrise, your friend is a goner.
Stop messing with me!
I suggest that you hurry.
I am sure that you do not want to see your friend die a horrible death, My Lord Baron.
You bastard!
Violence is unseemly, My Lord Baron.
Damn it!
Yeah, that is better.
A gentleman has to worry about little things like discretion.
There is no more fascinating spectacle than a man's death.
Yes, it almost feels as if one has become God, does it not?
His Excellency, the Baron d'Epinay.
I am sorry to disturb you at such an hour...
Is something the matter?
You do not seem entirely well.
Count!
I have a favor to ask of you!
What is the big idea?!
There is your 50 million ducats.
Now, you will take us to the hostage.
To the Colosseum!
Have the two of you been friends for a long time?
Yes, we have been best friends since we were children.
Ah, so you are childhood friends.
Constant friendship...
It is a wonderful thing, is it not?
Who do you like?
C'mon, tell me!
At least give me a hint!
You would not understand.
Luigi.
It is almost time.
Kill him.
So, have you made your peace?
C'mon, madam, let me kill him!
No, let me!
Oh, give it a rest, you two!
You can carve him up as much as you want after he is dead.
Now, then.
You should put up a brave front while you still can.
I wonder what you will sound like when you cry?
H-Hey, guys.
Um... Visitors to see the boss.
Who are they?
Please, Teresa, do not!
We cannot kill him yet!
B-Because we will not get the money!
And besides...
There is still a little time.
Stand aside!
If you are going to use that, use it on me!
Squabbling among yourselves is pathetic!
Thank you.
Stand back.
Are you trying to disgrace the boss?
I will be fine.
Go.
So, does that mean you have fallen for that girl?
That is so sweet...
But she is too much for you to handle, little boy.
Or maybe... you would rather become one of us?
You know, I think I will brand you...
Why, you...
Leave her alone!
I have come to meet with Signor Luigi Vampa, whose reputation is notorious on Luna.
And who are you?
My name is... Gankutsuou.
T-The King of the Cave?!
For one such as yourself who dwells in the darkness,
I have your money.
Now, hand over the hostage.
I am sorry, but you missed the deadline.
Always be punctual, that is my motto.
Punctuality is the politeness of kings, is that it?
I am deeply honored... by your gracious words!
I see...
Your skill is impressive.
But you cannot kill me.
A-Are you...
Are you really...
A-Are you really him?!
I do not work for the authorities.
If you would do me the honor of returning my friend,
You are not injured, I take it?
I had a feeling that you would come to rescue me.
If you wish to thank someone, thank the good Baron d'Epinay.
He was gravely concerned for your wellbeing.
Hey!
Miss!
Are you okay?
Say, I never asked you what your name was...
I am Albert.
Albert de Morcerf.
I am Peppo.
To tell you the truth, I was almost considering throwing in my lot with the bandits.
I am glad you are all right, Albert.
What took you so long, Franz?
I came this close to being killed, you know!
I was seriously...
What was that for?
Please, do not concern yourselves over the matter.
It served as a pleasant diversion for me.
But I have to do something to repay you.
In that case, might I ask one favor of you?
Anything at all!
Just name it!
I should like to take up residence in Paris at some point.
That is wonderful!
However, a rustic aristocrat such as myself has no connections in Paris.
As such, might I impose on you to act as my intermediary into Parisian society?
Think nothing of it!
In that case, I shall call on you on May 22nd, three months from this day,
Where in the world did you find this?
I found it.
At the opera house.
Oh, so that is where it was!
It shames me to say it, but I have looked everywhere for it.
This, too, shows that there is some bond between us.
Please accept it with my gratitude.
Think of it as a small token of our friendship.
Really?
It will serve to freeze the memory of this day, this hour, in time.
A memory which belongs to us alone.
Thank you so much!
I will cherish it!
Carnival has ended, so what are your plans now?
We are going to cut our trip short and take the evening shuttle back to Paris.
Hey, wait a minute!
I have already made plans of my own!
You never learn, do you?
And what plans might these be?
What do you mean?
It is none of your business.
Have you arranged a rendezvous, perhaps?
Sort of...
Love is a wonderful thing.
However, perhaps you have not noticed yet.
Or perhaps you knew, and arranged the rendezvous regardless.
I do hate to be the bearer of bad tidings, but...
A boy?
She is a boy?!
Come out and say it!
You think I am an idiot, do not you?!
Not really.
You are always looking down on me, laughing at me on the inside!
I am not laughing at you!
If I laughed at every boneheaded stunt you pulled, I would bust a gut!
Anyway, you were...
Thanks.
I owe you my life.
I appreciate it.
The fruits of betrayal must be plucked from the tree...
At long last, the appointed day arrives.
He comes to Paris along with a summer storm.
Next time on Gankutsuou, The Count of Monte Cristo, act 3,
Act 3: 5/22, Stormy
Bide your time, and hold out hope!
